summary: The Texas Flood Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2025 allocates $15 billion to the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) for disaster relief in response to severe flooding in Texas during 2025. The funds, available until expended, are to be used in accordance with the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act. The bill includes an emergency designation and mandates reporting on fund usage, geographic distribution, assistance provided, and any unmet needs every 180 days. Funds cannot be obligated after September 30, 2028.
